Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2013 07:32PM Siennasugar wrote: Hi , This my first post . I was diagnosed 08/30 with DCIS in my left breast. My BS ordered a MRI. I thought I would have a lumpectomy/radiation, and be done with it. The MRI showed other areas affected in the left breast. So I decided on a BMX, sentinel node biopsy, and immediate reconstruction-implants with anterior lat/dorsi flap. I had the surgery on 09/30, and I came home on 10/04 . The compession bra was killing me . I got a camisole with drain pouches by Amoena. It is so soft. Taking Vicodin,( - a little Benadryl for the itching from the Vicodin- ), Antibiotics,(- Zofran for the nausea from the antibiotics- ), and Colace- the constipation is a real issue. The drains are a pain. I have 4. I go to see my PS on Monday 10/07. I hope he removes them.The recovery is miserable, but doable. I have a great support system. I got a call from my BS yesterday saying that they sent the right breast tissue out to a second pathologist because they saw something on that tissue. That was the "healthy" breast. People were questioning my decision to remove it. I prayed before that decision. Thank God I listened.
